Alice Johnson.Action: Slinks warily by her father, not especially well put together.
Greets Kristen quietly and seems defensive when questioned about her appearance.
Shares a private moment with Kristen on the porch, allowing Kristen to console her.
Appears shy and lacks confidence, questions what is wrong with her appearance defensively.
Navigates a somewhat awkward social interaction with Kristen and family, responds calmly though defensively.
Engages in light, playful daydreaming about Dan, showing a friendly and confident side.
Responds quietly to Rick's teasing to avoid embarrassment, demonstrating sensitivity.
Daydreams about confidently flirting with Dan, showing an internal desire for confidence and social skill.
Becomes distracted and 'spaces out' during a social interaction, needing to be called back.
Finishes washing dishes quietly and waits for Johnson despite his lateness.
Obviously patient with Johnson's tiredness and drinking, tries to keep family peace.
Finishes washing dishes attentively and notices the car swerving into the driveway, showing awareness of her surroundings.
Waits patiently for Johnson to come in for dinner, showing a sense of timing and social awareness.
Takes a salad out of the fridge and places it in front of her father after his long work day
Internally daydreams about smashing the salad and angrily confronting her father about his drinking and behavior
Remains silent and does not answer her father's provocations
Chooses to cover her mirror with photos, avoiding seeing herself and reflecting on happier times with Rick

Expresses doubt and says 'I can't' before trying.
Sits beside Kristen and shares personal feelings about nightmares and dreams, offering comfort.

Responds with humor and openness during conversation, laughing with Kristen.
Explains her techniques to cope with nightmares calmly and confidently, showing knowledge and control over a difficult personal issue.

Listens attentively and shows concern for Kristen's distress, though she doesn't fully understand her.
Doesn't understand Kristen's explanation about bringing friends into dreams, shows confusion.
Remains silent and passive while Kristen deteriorates emotionally and physically; does not intervene or take control in a tense situation.

Laughs along with Sheila's joke, showing friendly interaction and ease with peers.

Responds calmly and attentively to Rick's urgent news about Kincaid and Joey.
Tries to comfort Kristen who is crying over lost friends.
Desperately trying not to make eye contact with Dan, sneakily peeking at him.

Pauses to notice and lightly touch the chalk drawing on the walkway, showing sensitivity and attentiveness.
Does not intervene or comfort Kristen when she is leaving under pressure, remaining silent and passive.

Notices the chalk drawing on the walkway and inspects it attentively, showing awareness and curiosity.
Forgets part of the rhyme and falters while reciting it.
Hesitates before joining the group, lingering to observe the drawing even as it disappears, showing cautiousness and attention to detail.
Comes crashing down on top of Kristen to intervene when she is in danger.

Is slapped hard by Kristen and appears dazed, indicating a momentary lack of awareness or control.
Reacts in utter horror as Kristen is attacked, showing empathy and concern.
Sits bolt upright screaming after nightmare and takes a moment to gather herself before moving on.
Sits bolt upright in bed, screaming, then takes a few breaths and gets her bearings before walking to the vanity and staring at the mirror.
Stares at a burning photograph and processes the strange events calmly enough to note the inscription and the fiery destruction of the photo before noticing the alteration in her reflection.
Grabs Rick and pulls him out to help find Kristen when she senses something is wrong.
Insists to others that Kristen's death was caused by Freddy and tries to warn them despite skepticism.
Abruptly walks away from the group after being challenged, showing withdrawal instead of open discussion.
Pulls Rick out of the room urgently to address the emergency with Kristen.
Immediately heads to Kristen's house and enters burning bedroom to confront reality.
Clearly states that Kristen's death was caused by Freddy, showing awareness beyond others' skepticism.
Experiences strong emotional reaction to the event, describing the dream horror as awful.
Abruptly walks away from the group during discussion,

Studies her reflection carefully and questions the changes in herself.

Breaks free from Rick's support and leaves when feeling overwhelmed.

Alice leaves her room to investigate a noise she hears downstairs, showing alertness and initiative.

Becomes embarrassed and self-conscious under scrutiny.

Buys a movie ticket and tries to settle and engage with others (movie patrons) despite discomfort.
Climbs out her bedroom window and maneuvers skillfully down to the street, replicating earlier moves seen from another character.
Looks for Dan at his corner but, not finding him and no one else in sight, she shows frustration yet still continues walking and turns a corner, adapting to the situation.
Takes a ticket and wanders into a movie theater alone, then calmly settles into her seat and begins watching despite discomfort caused by the film.

Struggles desperately to hold on and survive despite overwhelming forces.
Looks back as she makes her way into the diner, indicating caution or care.
Fights the powerful wind to hold onto the balcony edge and tries to crawl back up despite the extreme force.

Screams in distress and is ultimately ripped off the balcony and pulled through the screen.
Struggles to her feet after tumbling outside the diner despite harsh environmental conditions.
Studies the waitress closely, showing attentiveness and a hint of empathy for the waitress's weary appearance.

Admits confusion and fear about the situation (realizing they are trapped in a dream-like loop).
Recognizes they are going in circles and realizes she is still asleep, showing awareness of the situation.
Drives recklessly like a lunatic in an attempt to stop Freddy.
Slams the gas to try to attack Freddy and protect Dan, showing determination to help.
Sincerely apologizes to Dan after the crash, showing care and concern for him.

Takes sleeping pills to prepare herself mentally and physically for a dangerous encounter.
Takes and wears tokens from her friends as symbols of strength and support.
Addresses her reflection with determination and an almost ritualistic affirmation of protection against evil.
Discards her shotgun with a dismissive comment indicating confidence but no aggression toward others.
Powers up by integrating and improving gadgets from her friends, symbolizing skillful preparation and enhancement.

Tosses aside the shotgun, acknowledging its inadequacy compared to her upgraded abilities.

Showed shock and helplessness by crying out 'Nooo!!!' when Dan was slashed and wounded.
Despite intense danger, acted decisively and skillfully in combat and escape, demonstrating confident and capable behavior.
Rushes to Dan's side as he fades away, showing concern and quick reaction.
Crouches into a fighting position and delivers multiple kicks to Freddy confidently, showing fighting skill and strategic thinking.

Punches a hole in the wall and pulls out electric cables to use as a weapon, improvising effectively under pressure.
Uses electric cables and a gadget to fight Freddy, showing courage and determination.
Gags at seeing trapped souls in Freddy's sweater, indicating empathy and sensitivity.
Rips off the gadget from around her neck, assembles electric cables, and fires a powerful laser bolt at Freddy, temporarily wounding him.
Quickly adapts by grabbing a huge cross to fight Freddy when her initial attack doesn't hold.
Handles the cross easily and charges at Freddy, showing confidence and physical capability.
Shows hesitation or gagging reaction upon seeing the trapped souls in Freddy's sweater, indicating emotional disturbance.
Fails to prevent Freddy from disarming her and was physically overpowered multiple times, ending up bloody and crumpled.
Sustains frustration and physical defeat but still struggles to fend off Freddy.
Encourages the trapped souls to be freed, helping innocent victims escape from Freddy's body.
Stands alone quietly after the battle, showing resolve but not withdrawing from responsibility.
